summary.p: Sends missing components of the armillary sphere, which he recently had delivered to him. Reminds him of the delivery of paper for Martin Peyer and Myconius.

div.p: Grace and peace from the Lord.

Behold, once again I trouble you with my letters, but I ask you to grant pardon, for I continually interrupt your studies with my trifles; indeed, there are reasons for this. I previously sent the sphere through Myconius's maid, which I hope you have received; however, I forgot to send the center of the sphere and the leaden fittings, which connect the colures and support the axis of the world. I am sending these to you now and ask that you receive them with a fair mind.
I do not write more now, lest I be a nuisance to you. I only ask this, that you ensure Martin Peyer receives the paper he desires through Froschauer and that the same is sent to Myconius.
Please greet your mother and wife along with the entire family in my name. Farewell, most kind father, and keep me recommended to you.
Basel, from the house of Mr. Myconius, March 11, 1539. Yours most observantly,
To the truly pious and learned man Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, his most esteemed patron.
